intro: Dichroanthus virescens, commonly known as the green-flowered dichroanthus, is a herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are usually green on the upper surface and lighter in color on the underside. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, which are typically borne on long pedicels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks. Dichroanthus virescens is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms.
